title: RainingSage
author: RainingSage
created_time: November 04, 2023, 09:27:16 PMLast edit: November 05, 2023, 12:37:17 AM by RainingSage
content: I'm offering my services as a writer for your btc.I'm charging $0.02 a word. Which is roughly $10 for 500 words.Or roughly 1mbtc for 1500 words.Please let me know if interested. I don't have past experience, so if your interested in my services you can tell me what you'd like to me write about, and if it's not up to snuff then you don't have to pay.

comments.author: DaNNy001
comments.body: I think for you to advertise such service better, it would be nice for you to actually put up some link to some of your past work or provide a site where we can verify your claims as a good writer if not everyone can just come up and offer such service even with poor skills

comments.author: virasog
comments.body: Quote from: RainingSage on November 04, 2023, 10:00:05 PMQuote from: DaNNy001 on November 04, 2023, 09:29:52 PMI think for you to advertise such service better, it would be nice for you to actually put up some link to some of your past work or provide a site where we can verify your claims as a good writer if not everyone can just come up and offer such service even with poor skillsCheck the edited opening post. I'm going to cut to the chase here, if my writing skills meet your needs you'll see it as you review the article. If not, your not expected to pay. While this seems to be a good tactic in case you do not have any portfolio but remember this open ended offer can be miss used by the employees. Some scammer may offer you to write and do not pay you even if he likes your article.Why not until you get any offers try writing your own articles and use them as your portfolio, this way not only people will know how you can write but at the same time you do not have to come across an awkward situation where you write and not get paid.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: I'm not sure that how you came up with the idea of charging $0.02 per word but that's not the way to get clients if you don't have any previous writing experience. I recommend you to write some good articles and then use those articles as samples so anyone who reads those articles can decide whether they want your services or not. I also recommend you to offer your services for free to a few clients but no more than 500 words for free and once you get some written content then you can share those as your samples without any question. That way you'll get clients who might pay you for your work.

comments.author: RikandMorty1
comments.body: I suggest you start working on your English first before offering any copywriting services. The grammar of your post isn't very promising.
